perturbation.original_text:
"Subscriber” means any individual who purchases mobile content programming and: (a) who actually pays the applicable Subscription Fee; and (b) does not
receive a refund of such Subscription Fee for any reason within thirty (30) days from the end of the payment period for which the Subscription Fee was paid. A
Subscriber remains a “Subscriber” for the purposes of this Agreement so long as such individual continues to pay the applicable Subscription Fee.
perturbation.changed_text: "Subscriber” means any individual who accesses mobile content programming, regardless of payment status. A subscriber remains a “Subscriber” for the purposes of this Agreement only for the duration of their initial access, irrespective of continued payments.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition requires payment and no refunds for an individual to be considered a 'Subscriber.' The modified definition removes the payment requirement and limits the subscriber status to the initial access period, regardless of subsequent payments, creating a direct contradiction. This creates ambiguity on the obligations of both parties concerning subscribers.

perturbation.original_text:
9.3 Confidentiality. The parties acknowledge that Confidential Information is valuable and unique and that disclosure in breach of this confidentiality provision will
result in irreparable injury to its owner. From the Effective Date and for a period of two (2) years from the date of termination or expiration of this Agreement,
neither party will use, disclose, or permit any person to obtain any Confidential Information of the other party.
perturbation.changed_text: 9.3 Confidentiality. The parties acknowledge that Confidential Information is valuable and unique. From the Effective Date until either party provides written notice to the other, each party may use, disclose, and permit persons to obtain Confidential Information.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause strictly prohibits the disclosure of confidential information for two years after termination. The modified clause introduces an element of optionality, allowing for disclosure unless explicitly stopped by written notice. This undermines the original's protective intent and makes the enforcement of confidentiality uncertain.

perturbation.original_text:
7.1 General Termination Rights. Either party may terminate the Agreement at any time in the event of a material breach by the other party that remains uncured
after thirty (30) days written notice of the breach.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.1 General Termination Rights. Either party may terminate the Agreement at any time, with or without cause, without prior notice.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause allows termination only for material breach and after a 30-day cure period. The altered clause allows immediate termination for any reason or no reason, completely negating the protections in the original termination clause. This significantly alters the risk assessment of both parties and the stability of the contract.
